<a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="The Ascent" style="width:100%;max-width: 165px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="165" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8yOC8xNTk3ODU4MTU0LVRoZUFzY2VudC1Mb2dvX18xXy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>The Brew writers are wrapping up vacation, which means that the standard newsletter format (with the Markets graphic and bite-sized stories) is coming back on Monday. We also can’t wait. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But first, I wanted to devote this <em>final</em> special issue to something that’s on a lot of our minds: New Year’s Resolutions. I’m sure many of you are in the same boat, but when I make “resolutions” every year I do it half-heartedly and without any real game plan for accomplishing them. There has to be a better way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So recently I dug into the research around <strong style="color:#000"><em>goal setting</em></strong> and will relay some of the most interesting findings in this newsletter. I hope it's useful.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—Neal Freyman</p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SCIENCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/best-way-set-goals-look-science?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Goal Setting: The Fundamentals
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="To-do list gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26ufnwz3wDUli7GU0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="To-do list gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26ufnwz3wDUli7GU0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Asking why people set goals is like asking why McDonald's fries last for several years without getting moldy—they just do and it’s best not to ask why. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But let’s ask anyway: Why do goals exist? The answer isn’t complicated. People, and companies and governments and nonprofits, set goals because they want to <strong style="color:#000"><em>motivate </em></strong>themselves or their workforces to complete a particular task. It’s probably the most popularly accepted method of brain hacking. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Goals are everywhere around you. They’re in...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kickstarter campaigns</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Quarterly earnings reports</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Books (“let me just finish this chapter!”) </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, Morning Brew’s referral program is entirely based on hitting goals: readers need three referrals for Light Roast, five for stickers, and so on. The system uses benchmarks to encourage people to share the newsletter, and it’s been <a href="https://medium.com/the-mission/how-morning-brews-referral-program-built-an-audience-of-1-5-million-subscribers-3315482c1aa5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wildly effective</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s the best way to set goals?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Please, PLEASE do not type that into Google. I did and ended up in a listicle hellhole that burned a hole in my brain the size of 1 billion neurons. But, after some digging, I found some real science on the subject. A fellow by the name of Edwin Locke, together with a few colleagues, developed a goal setting theory that is generally accepted by the broader academic community. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s the 101: </strong>You want better performance? Make your goals <em>specific </em>and <em>difficult</em>. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Specific: </strong></span><span>If you want a healthier diet, you’re better off pledging to “eat one dessert per week” rather than promising you'll “eat more veggies,” which is vague. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Difficult: </strong></span><span>Try to set your goals in the 90th percentile of difficulty. By having tougher goals, you’ll simply work harder and be more focused than if your goal was easy to accomplish. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can’t go wrong setting difficult, specific goals—unfortunately, there’s more to goal setting theory than just those two terms. Without getting too in the weeds, I'll present several other useful concepts:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Commitment: </strong></span><span>As we all know, setting a goal is one thing...following through is another, far more difficult thing. There are several variables that affect commitment, such as who assigns the goal and whether the person believes they can </span><span><em>actually</em></span><span> achieve it.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Feedback: </strong></span><span>Feedback is an important tool on the goal-achieving journey. It helps you recognize what you’re doing wrong, so you can improve your performance accordingly. Let’s use a simple example: Hiring a tennis coach will help you achieve your goal of hitting a topspin two-handed backhand faster than if you don't have access to that training.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Squeezing decades of research on human psychology and organizational behavior into 400 words is a very specific, very difficult goal that I hope I’ve just attained. Keep reading as we dive deeper into the world of goal setting. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/video-games-case-study-using-specific-goals-motivation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Goals and Video Games
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Super Mario " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTg5L3N1cGVyX21hcmlvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nintendo</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know when you used to jump on the flagpole at the end of a <em>Super Mario Bros.</em> level and this overwhelming feeling of satisfaction washed over you? That’s because you just completed a goal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many video games, from <em>Super Mario </em>to <em>Candy Crush</em>, show how goals, constructed the right way, can lead to better performance and skills development. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Video game goals are specific: </strong></span><span>Before I begin a level, I fully understand what I need to achieve. In </span><span><em>Super Mario</em></span><span>, I need to get to that flagpole before a turtle shell projectile sends me plummeting to my death.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">They are difficult: </strong></span><span>Had there been no turtle shell projectiles on my path to the flagpole, I would have felt no sense of accomplishment and probably would've stopped playing the game.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Games provide feedback: </strong></span><span>If I keep dying on my way to the flagpole, then it’s clear I’m doing something wrong. I can adjust my strategy to improve my performance.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Games are so effective at motivating people to accomplish tasks that <em>non</em>-game programs have borrowed these tactics in a process known as "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamification?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gamification</a>." The app <a href="https://www.duolingo.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Duolingo</a> is a perfect example—it motivates users to learn new languages by allowing them to earn virtual coins and “level up.” Many fitness apps also use gamification to help you become a better athlete.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CORPORATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/quick-look-okr-method-corporate-goalsetting?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bring in the Suits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Office space exec" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTg4L29mZmljZV9zcGFjZV9leGVjLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Office Space</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies are composed of a swarm of employees with their own desires, motivations, and foul-smelling lunches. How to direct them toward a common goal is a question that’s weighed on managers for centuries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the most popular goal setting frameworks in Corporate America is “<a href="https://www.whatmatters.com/series_entries/s1-2-how-do-okrs-work/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">OKR</a>,” which makes sense because it is a confusing acronym. OKRs are the brainchild of Intel exec Andy Grove and were popularized by venture capitalist John Doerr, who learned about the method from Grove and introduced it to a number of companies, most famously Google. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s probably time to tell you that OKR stands for “Objectives and Key Results.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Objectives</strong></span><span> refer to the main goals your team is trying to accomplish over a given time frame. They should be aggressive but realistic. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Key Results </strong></span><span>are the 3–5 measurable benchmarks that form the roadmap to accomplishing your Objective. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over at Google, they grade Key Results on a scale of 0–1.0. The “<a href="https://rework.withgoogle.com/guides/set-goals-with-okrs/steps/introduction/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sweet spot</a>” is to hit a 60%–70% grade on your OKRs: anything higher means you aren’t setting ambitious-enough goals, and a lower score means your goals could be unrealistic.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OKR is just one strategy for setting goals at the corporate level (it can also be used in your personal life, too). This <a href="https://www.vox.com/2018/5/19/17369636/transcript-kleiner-perkins-john-doerr-book-recode-decode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">podcast episode</a> featuring John Doerr provides a more in-depth introduction to the methodology. You can also check out his book, <a href="https://bookshop.org/books/measure-what-matters-how-google-bono-and-the-gates-foundation-rock-the-world-with-okrs/9780525536222#:~:text=%22Measure%20What%20Matters%20takes%20you,of%20Andy%20Grove's%20finest%20legacies.%22&text=%22Measure%20What%20Matters%20will%20transform,for%20yourself%20and%20your%20organization.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Measure What Matters</em></a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE ASCENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Decree: Old Credit Cards Banished From Wallet Kingdom
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="The Ascent" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjA0MS8xNjA4MDY0NTQ1LUdldHR5SW1hZ2VzLTU4NTMyODA3NC1tYi0yLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the second day of this New Year, and with our readers bearing witness, we, Morning Brew, hereby decree that old credit cards are now and forever BANISHED from Wallet Kingdom.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this card</a> has arrived, our old cards wear our leather thin. Begone, outdated plastic!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Readers, our old credit cards charged us interest; <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this card</a> has <strong style="color:#000">no interest until 2022</strong>. With our old credit cards we struggled to secure significant amounts of cash back for our families and allies; <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this new card</a> has up to <strong style="color:#000">5% bonus cash back</strong>, a figure nearly unheard of across all the credit lands!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most offensively, our old cards wore smelly and unfashionable tunics, but <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this new card</a> comes in lots of sleek colors, and will surely represent us well when whipped out at fancy restaurants!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">May our chalices be full of <strong style="color:#000">cashback rewards and 0% intro APR offers</strong>! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-cash-back-review-v2-csr/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-01022021-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb&testId=the-ascent-discb-landing-page&cellId=6&campaign=the-ascent" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here here (is thy new card)</a>!</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
Q&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/morning-brew-product-manager-ashna-mankotia-shares-goalsetting-tips?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ask Ashna
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ashna Mankotia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTkwL2FzaG5hX21hbmtvdGlhLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Starter Hacks</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s bring many of the abstract goal setting concepts we've talked about to the real world. I asked Ashna Mankotia, a product manager at Morning Brew and goal setting guru, a few questions about her approach to personal growth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How do you select your personal goals? And over what time frame? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I set yearly goals in January and check in (and sometimes edit) them every 3 months. I try to make sure my goals are categorically broad and help develop me in more than just one way. For example: health/fitness, financial, and personal development. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You tweeted, "I LOVE goal setting." Why? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In my early 20s I realized that the life I wanted for myself was in fact achievable. I could have everything I ever wanted if I was willing to figure out how to get it. To me, goal setting feels like the first step in living the life of my dreams. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What makes a good goal?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I think all goals should be two parts: 1) value-based and 2) accompanied with objective metrics. For example, <em>becoming financially responsible</em> could be your value-based goal, but creating and sticking to a budget, paying off 30% of your debt, or contributing x% of your income to retirement are all specific objectives that you can measure. Don't think of a goal as a pass/fail situation, but more like a progress bar. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How do you make sure you stay committed? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, you are in a relationship with yourself. When you forgo your goals, you're kind of cheating on yourself. And you deserve better than that. Secondly, you can't rely on motivation. Motivation is fleeting, so do the thing even when you don't want to. That's how goals are achieved. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What specific tools do you use to help you achieve your goals?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I use <a href="https://www.notion.so/login?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Notion</a> so I have one central place to look back on my goals each year and see how they have grown with me. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's the most ambitious goal you've ever set? Did you accomplish it? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the beginning of 2019 I could barely run a mile but set a goal to run a 10k. This genuinely felt impossible but on June 9, 2019, I ran my first 10k in 1:03:07. Then, without really thinking about it, on June 21, I signed up for a half-marathon. I figured if I could do what felt impossible once, why not again? On October 20, I ran 21k in 2:23:58. Now, when I set my goals, I try to remember this and while I celebrate "10k" milestones, I set my sights on "half-marathon" goals. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do you mind sharing your goals for 2021?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two of my 2021 goals that feel very ambitious (but exciting): </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. I want to feel stronger. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Metric 1: I want to be able to do 75 pushups at once (currently at about 15 lol)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Metric 2: Create, follow, and iterate on a workout program with more strength training and less cardio </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. I want to own being a creator, and feel less self-conscious about the content I put on social media. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Metric 1: Reach 10k followers on TikTok</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Metric 2: Reach 5k followers on Twitter</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s give Ashna's 2021 goals a jumpstart. You can follow her on <a href="https://twitter.com/ohmygoshna?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a> and <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@ohmygoshna?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok</a> (I 10/10 recommend her accounts).</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESOURCES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/list-resources-different-goalsetting-methodologies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Homework
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are more ways to set goals than ways to eat a Reese’s. I dove into that listicle hellscape I mentioned earlier to surface some of the most popular and unconventional methods to help you get started on your goal setting journey. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/blog/productivity/how-to-write-smart-goals?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SMART</a> (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-Bound) goals </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.smartinsights.com/marketing-planning/marketing-models/ogsm-model-framework/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The OGSM model</a>: Objective, goals, strategies, and measures</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://jamesclear.com/buffett-focus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Warren Buffett’s</a> “2 list” strategy</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.thebalancesmb.com/how-to-set-business-goals-with-just-one-word-2951849?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">One-word</a> goal setting</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.thebalancesmb.com/how-to-set-achievable-goals-with-backward-goal-setting-2951823?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Backward</a> goal setting</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://cultivatedculture.com/goal-setting/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tiered goals</a>: annual goals vs. quarterly vs. monthly </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://agileleanlife.com/goal-setting/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A framework</a> specifically designed for the 21st century </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.sitepoint.com/how-to-create-a-big-hairy-audacious-goal/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BHAG</a>: Big Hairy Audacious Goal</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.geckoboard.com/blog/setting-company-priorities-golden-circle/#.WihM0LQ-d0s?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Golden Circle</a></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Alternatively, you could ignore the advice provided in this newsletter and set 0 goals. <a href="https://www.bbc.com/worklife/article/20171117-why-we-should-all-give-up-on-goals-already?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This article</a> argues that our relationship with goal setting is toxic and sets us up for a life devoid of fulfillment.  </p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top:20px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eThe Brew writers are wrapping up vacation, which means that the standard newsletter format (with the Markets graphic and bite-sized stories) is coming back on Monday. We also can’t wait. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut first, I wanted to devote this \u003cem\u003efinal\u003c/em\u003e special issue to something that’s on a lot of our minds: New Year’s Resolutions. I’m sure many of you are in the same boat, but when I make “resolutions” every year I do it half-heartedly and without any real game plan for accomplishing them. There has to be a better way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo recently I dug into the research around \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003egoal setting\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e and will relay some of the most interesting findings in this newsletter. I hope it's useful.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END HEADER --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSCIENCE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/best-way-set-goals-look-science?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGoal Setting: The Fundamentals\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"To-do list gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/26ufnwz3wDUli7GU0/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"To-do list gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/26ufnwz3wDUli7GU0/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAsking why people set goals is like asking why McDonald's fries last for several years without getting moldy—they just do and it’s best not to ask why. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut let’s ask anyway: Why do goals exist? The answer isn’t complicated. People, and companies and governments and nonprofits, set goals because they want to \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003emotivate \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003ethemselves or their workforces to complete a particular task. It’s probably the most popularly accepted method of brain hacking. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoals are everywhere around you. They’re in...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKickstarter campaigns\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQuarterly earnings reports\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBooks (“let me just finish this chapter!”) \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, Morning Brew’s referral program is entirely based on hitting goals: readers need three referrals for Light Roast, five for stickers, and so on. The system uses benchmarks to encourage people to share the newsletter, and it’s been \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/the-mission/how-morning-brews-referral-program-built-an-audience-of-1-5-million-subscribers-3315482c1aa5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewildly effective\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s the best way to set goals?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlease, PLEASE do not type that into Google. I did and ended up in a listicle hellhole that burned a hole in my brain the size of 1 billion neurons. But, after some digging, I found some real science on the subject. A fellow by the name of Edwin Locke, together with a few colleagues, developed a goal setting theory that is generally accepted by the broader academic community. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s the 101: \u003c/strong\u003eYou want better performance? Make your goals \u003cem\u003especific \u003c/em\u003eand \u003cem\u003edifficult\u003c/em\u003e. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpecific: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you want a healthier diet, you’re better off pledging to “eat one dessert per week” rather than promising you'll “eat more veggies,” which is vague. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDifficult: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTry to set your goals in the 90th percentile of difficulty. By having tougher goals, you’ll simply work harder and be more focused than if your goal was easy to accomplish. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou can’t go wrong setting difficult, specific goals—unfortunately, there’s more to goal setting theory than just those two terms. Without getting too in the weeds, I'll present several other useful concepts:\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCommitment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs we all know, setting a goal is one thing...following through is another, far more difficult thing. There are several variables that affect commitment, such as who assigns the goal and whether the person believes they can \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eactually\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e achieve it.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFeedback: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFeedback is an important tool on the goal-achieving journey. It helps you recognize what you’re doing wrong, so you can improve your performance accordingly. Let’s use a simple example: Hiring a tennis coach will help you achieve your goal of hitting a topspin two-handed backhand faster than if you don't have access to that training.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSqueezing decades of research on human psychology and organizational behavior into 400 words is a very specific, very difficult goal that I hope I’ve just attained. Keep reading as we dive deeper into the world of goal setting. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know when you used to jump on the flagpole at the end of a \u003cem\u003eSuper Mario Bros.\u003c/em\u003e level and this overwhelming feeling of satisfaction washed over you? That’s because you just completed a goal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany video games, from \u003cem\u003eSuper Mario \u003c/em\u003eto \u003cem\u003eCandy Crush\u003c/em\u003e, show how goals, constructed the right way, can lead to better performance and skills development. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVideo game goals are specific: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBefore I begin a level, I fully understand what I need to achieve. In \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSuper Mario\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, I need to get to that flagpole before a turtle shell projectile sends me plummeting to my death.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThey are difficult: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHad there been no turtle shell projectiles on my path to the flagpole, I would have felt no sense of accomplishment and probably would've stopped playing the game.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGames provide feedback: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf I keep dying on my way to the flagpole, then it’s clear I’m doing something wrong. I can adjust my strategy to improve my performance.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGames are so effective at motivating people to accomplish tasks that \u003cem\u003enon\u003c/em\u003e-game programs have borrowed these tactics in a process known as \"\u003ca href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamification?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egamification\u003c/a\u003e.\" The app \u003ca href=\"https://www.duolingo.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDuolingo\u003c/a\u003e is a perfect example—it motivates users to learn new languages by allowing them to earn virtual coins and “level up.” Many fitness apps also use gamification to help you become a better athlete.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F12%2F30%2Fvideo-games-case-study-using-specific-goals-motivation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Games+are+so+effective+at+motivating+people++that+non-game+programs+have+borrowed+these+tactics+in+a+process+known+as+%E2%80%9Cgamification%22\u0026url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/video-games-case-study-using-specific-goals-motivation\u0026via=MorningBrew\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTg4L29mZmljZV9zcGFjZV9leGVjLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eOffice Space\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompanies are composed of a swarm of employees with their own desires, motivations, and foul-smelling lunches. How to direct them toward a common goal is a question that’s weighed on managers for centuries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the most popular goal setting frameworks in Corporate America is “\u003ca href=\"https://www.whatmatters.com/series_entries/s1-2-how-do-okrs-work/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOKR\u003c/a\u003e,” which makes sense because it is a confusing acronym. OKRs are the brainchild of Intel exec Andy Grove and were popularized by venture capitalist John Doerr, who learned about the method from Grove and introduced it to a number of companies, most famously Google. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s probably time to tell you that OKR stands for “Objectives and Key Results.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eObjectives\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e refer to the main goals your team is trying to accomplish over a given time frame. They should be aggressive but realistic. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKey Results \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eare the 3–5 measurable benchmarks that form the roadmap to accomplishing your Objective. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver at Google, they grade Key Results on a scale of 0–1.0. The “\u003ca href=\"https://rework.withgoogle.com/guides/set-goals-with-okrs/steps/introduction/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esweet spot\u003c/a\u003e” is to hit a 60%–70% grade on your OKRs: anything higher means you aren’t setting ambitious-enough goals, and a lower score means your goals could be unrealistic.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOKR is just one strategy for setting goals at the corporate level (it can also be used in your personal life, too). This \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2018/5/19/17369636/transcript-kleiner-perkins-john-doerr-book-recode-decode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epodcast episode\u003c/a\u003e featuring John Doerr provides a more in-depth introduction to the methodology. You can also check out his book, \u003ca href=\"https://bookshop.org/books/measure-what-matters-how-google-bono-and-the-gates-foundation-rock-the-world-with-okrs/9780525536222#:~:text=%22Measure%20What%20Matters%20takes%20you,of%20Andy%20Grove's%20finest%20legacies.%22\u0026text=%22Measure%20What%20Matters%20will%20transform,for%20yourself%20and%20your%20organization.?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eStarter Hacks\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s bring many of the abstract goal setting concepts we've talked about to the real world. I asked Ashna Mankotia, a product manager at Morning Brew and goal setting guru, a few questions about her approach to personal growth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow do you select your personal goals? And over what time frame? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI set yearly goals in January and check in (and sometimes edit) them every 3 months. I try to make sure my goals are categorically broad and help develop me in more than just one way. For example: health/fitness, financial, and personal development. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou tweeted, \"I LOVE goal setting.\" Why? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn my early 20s I realized that the life I wanted for myself was in fact achievable. I could have everything I ever wanted if I was willing to figure out how to get it. To me, goal setting feels like the first step in living the life of my dreams. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat makes a good goal?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI think all goals should be two parts: 1) value-based and 2) accompanied with objective metrics. For example, \u003cem\u003ebecoming financially responsible\u003c/em\u003e could be your value-based goal, but creating and sticking to a budget, paying off 30% of your debt, or contributing x% of your income to retirement are all specific objectives that you can measure. Don't think of a goal as a pass/fail situation, but more like a progress bar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow do you make sure you stay committed? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, you are in a relationship with yourself. When you forgo your goals, you're kind of cheating on yourself. And you deserve better than that. Secondly, you can't rely on motivation. Motivation is fleeting, so do the thing even when you don't want to. That's how goals are achieved. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat specific tools do you use to help you achieve your goals?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI use \u003ca href=\"https://www.notion.so/login?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNotion\u003c/a\u003e so I have one central place to look back on my goals each year and see how they have grown with me. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's the most ambitious goal you've ever set? Did you accomplish it? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the beginning of 2019 I could barely run a mile but set a goal to run a 10k. This genuinely felt impossible but on June 9, 2019, I ran my first 10k in 1:03:07. Then, without really thinking about it, on June 21, I signed up for a half-marathon. I figured if I could do what felt impossible once, why not again? On October 20, I ran 21k in 2:23:58. Now, when I set my goals, I try to remember this and while I celebrate \"10k\" milestones, I set my sights on \"half-marathon\" goals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDo you mind sharing your goals for 2021?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo of my 2021 goals that feel very ambitious (but exciting): \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. I want to feel stronger. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMetric 1: I want to be able to do 75 pushups at once (currently at about 15 lol)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMetric 2: Create, follow, and iterate on a workout program with more strength training and less cardio \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. I want to own being a creator, and feel less self-conscious about the content I put on social media. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMetric 1: Reach 10k followers on TikTok\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMetric 2: Reach 5k followers on Twitter\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s give Ashna's 2021 goals a jumpstart.
